availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Urban Kennedy states that David Chestnut joind rebel army & committed depredations upon property of citzens of Ky, on his return took oath amnesty is behaving very well in mean time he was indicted and his father Saml Chestnut became the youngs bail & sponser for judt of 200 the young man confessing & his father repleved, The old man is a good man an excellent citzen member society; his condition is rather reduced and he has suffered much distress of mind, in fact he is an object of sympathy,
This judt was rendered at the Oct Term 1865 of Todd circuit court
He states that in his judt it is a case deserving executive clemency as to both, in as much as the young man is conducting himself in a worthy manner.

Todd Cir Ct
vs
David Chestnut
$200 --
Trespass
Remitted 3d Dec /65
